com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.identifier

Interface IndexingIdentifiers

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DocumentIdentifiers, Ids, QueryIdentifiers, References, StateIds
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractIds, AbstractReferences, AbstractStateIds, Databases, Id, IdsBuilder, Reference, ReferencesBuilder, StateId, StateIdsBuilder

    public interface IndexingIdentifiers
    IndexingIdentifiers are document identifiers that can be used in the data of a DREREPLACE. e.g.: 
        IndexingIdentifiers identifiers = ...;

    // Build up the first line of the replace body
    StringBuilder dreReplace = new StringBuilder()
            .append('#')
            .append(identifiers.getIndexingIdentifierName())
            .append(' ')
            .append(identifiers.toIndexingString())
            .append('\n');

      • ALL

        static final IndexingIdentifiers ALL
        IndexingIdentifier to represent DREALL, which can be reused to replace fields on all the documents in an engine. This might be used when purging a particular field-value pair from an entire engine without the need to explicitly find which documents have that value.

        This object is immutable.

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Whether or not the identifier is empty.

        An empty identifier is one that cannot correspond to any documents, e.g. an empty reference list. Under some circumstances it can be unsafe to use an empty identifier as it could match all documents, rather than no documents. Though the classes in this API attempt to cope with this contingency as smoothly as possible (using dummy values and throwing exceptions as appropriate), it is usually preferable to do an empty check prior to using an identifier and handling that case separately.

        Returns:
        true if the identifier is empty

      • toIndexingString

        String toIndexingString()
        The string representation of this identifier, suitable for use as part of a DREREPLACE.

        Though the IndexingIdentifiers interface does not prescribe an implementation of the Object.toString() method, in practice it usually gives an ACI-ready version of the identifier. In most cases this will be the same as the indexing version but care should be taken to use the correct method as differences between the strings can cause subtly incorrect behaviour.

        Returns:
        A DREREPLACE identifier

      • getIndexingIdentifierName

        String getIndexingIdentifierName()
        The identifier name, as used in DREREPLACE. It will not include the leading #. e.g. DREDOCREF.
        Returns:
        A DREREPLACE identifier name
